newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan to raise tariff on pork through June - paper.
newsitem.headline: Japan to raise tariff on pork through June - paper.

text.p: Japan has decided this week to reinstate the "emergency import safeguard," which imposes higher tariff rates, on its pork imports from April 1 through to the end of June, the Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported.
The paper said in its Friday evening edition that the measure would raise the average import price at port by 24 percent compared to prices not protected by the safeguard.
It said the safeguards had already been in place since July 1996, and were scheduled to end in March this year.

The safeguards, in accordance with the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT) on agricultural products, come in to effect whenever the average volume of imports reach a level above 19 percent over the average of the previous three years.
The decision was agreed between Japan's agriculture ministry and the finance ministry on Friday, the paper said.
